history.content:
I'm an L&S declared junior looking for help planning my schedule next year. I worked at a company doing iOS development internship last summer and already committed to go back for this summer, and most likely a full time position after graduation based on my conversations with them. However I took CS 161 this semester and really fell in love with security.

I was planning to work part time next Spring (my last semester) so originally planned to just take EE16A alone (since I put it off till the very end...) for just 4 units my last semester, and take my last 2 required upper divs in Fall. I've already taken (for upperdivs) CS 188, CS 186 and CS 161.

Which classes should I be prioritizing? I DEFINITELY want to take the new Cyber War course in the Fall since I don't want to risk having it not offered in Spring. I also thought that 168 (only offered in Fall) is probably very important for security, but also think that 162 is important too, but I'm worried about its heavy workload fitting in with my schedule. (If I did it in Spring I'd have 16A + 162 while working part time which seems like a lot). I could take it alone in Spring instead of 16A, but then I'd have Cyber Wars + 168 + 16A in FalI. How hard would that workload be? Since I don't know the workload of cyber wars I'm a little worried. Would it be ok to NOT take 162 and still pursue security/iOS?

Any recommendations for my interests or how to balance workloads is welcome, thank you! Or if anyone has similar interests with both iOS and security and knows anything about careers (do they exist?) combining both of those any help would be appreciated.
history.subject: Most important/relevant courses for security and iOS?

history.content:
I'm an L&S declared junior looking for help planning my schedule next year. I worked at a company doing iOS development internship last summer and already committed to go back for this summer, and most likely a full time position after graduation based on my conversations with them. However I took CS 161 this semester and really fell in love with security, particularly software/web/network/malware, not so much cryptography.

I was planning to work part time next Spring (my last semester) so originally planned to just take EE16A alone (since I put it off till the very end...) for just 4 units my last semester, and take my last 2 required upper divs in Fall. I've already taken (for upperdivs) CS 188, CS 186 and CS 161.

Which classes should I be prioritizing? I DEFINITELY want to take the new Cyber War course in the Fall since I don't want to risk having it not offered in Spring. I also thought that 168 (only offered in Fall) is probably very important for security, but I also wondered about 162 as that is important too, but worried about the heavy workload fitting in with my schedule. (If I took it in Spring, 16A + 162 would still be pretty heavy and difficult to do while working part time I assume? And for Fall, Cyber Wars + 168 + 16A + breadth also sounds pretty heavy to be on the safe side, since cyber wars is new and no one really knows the workload yet.) Would it be ok to NOT take 162 and still pursue security/iOS?

Any recommendations for my interests or how to balance workloads is welcome, thank you! Or if anyone has similar interests with both iOS and security and knows anything about careers (do they exist?) combining both of those any help would be appreciated.
history.subject: Most important/relevant courses for security and iOS?

(If I took it in Spring, 16A + 162 would still be pretty heavy and difficult to do while working part time I assume? Any recommendations for my interests or how to balance workloads is welcome, thank you! Or if anyone has similar interests with both iOS and security and knows anything about careers (do they exist?) combining both of those any help would be appreciated.
history.subject: Most important/relevant courses for security and iOS?

history.content:
I'm an L&S declared junior looking for help planning my schedule next year. I worked at a company doing iOS development internship last summer and already committed to go back for this summer, and most likely a full time position after graduation based on my conversations with them. However I took CS 161 this semester and really fell in love with security. 

I was planning to work part time next Spring (my last semester) so originally planned to just take EE16A alone (since I put it off till the very end...) since last semester seniors can take fewer than 13 units. Then I figured most of the classes offered aren't very relevant to iOS besides 186, which I've already taken. So I decided to focus on security and hopefully one day will have a chance to work in that field, hopefully in combination with iOS (if those jobs exist!). I've already taken 61ABC, 70, math requirements, STAT133, CS 188, CS 186 and CS 161.

Which classes should I be prioritizing? I realized I DEFINITELY want to take the new Cyber War course in the Fall since it sounds really cool and I don't want to risk having it not offered in Spring. I also thought that 168 is probably very important for security, but I also wondered about 162 as that is important too, but worried about the heavy workload fitting in with my schedule. (If I took it in Spring, 16A + 162 would still be pretty heavy and difficult to do while working part time I assume? And for Fall, Cyber Wars + 168 + 16A + breadth also sounds pretty heavy to be on the safe side since cyber wars is new and no one really knows the workload yet.) Would it be ok to NOT take 162 and still pursue security/iOS?

Any recommendations for my interests or how to balance workloads is welcome, thank you! Or if anyone has similar interests with both iOS and security and knows anything about careers including both of those any help would be appreciated.
